text: We are exploring Berlin apartments with Housetrip and we're spotlighting Housetrip's cool hosts!
One of the cool things about staying in an apartment rental
is the local feeling you get when traveling
you don't feel like a tourist here!
Most hosts are passionate about their accommodation and have great stories to tell of how they got into apartment rentals

we met up with two cool Housetrip hosts
during our stay in Berlin

Martina of the Five Lofts bought this
complex with her husband in 1985

when the Berlin Wall was still standing
their friends thought they were crazy

but they had hoped that one day the wall
would fall and now they are an apartment building

in one of the trendiest neighbourhoods of
the city
Stephan and his wife started buying apartments in this building in 2001
to have more room for their growing business

they found that their relationship
thrived when they were renovating apartments

so they follow their passion and bought
more apartments to renovate and rent out
as vacation rentals
The Berlin Lofts have a rich history

originally a horse stable for the
military it was converted to loft
apartments in the sixties

the first politically motivated commune
in Germany set up house here

and Stephan remembers as neighbours
telling him firsthand accounts of the
time that they occupied the building
when we started to live here ummm
we notice that there were people knowing
this famous commune 1 who stayed here
and this was maybe Frau Dominic and she was
living in the front building for almost 50 years
if you're step into the history
you see that it's all connected somehow
right, and that's why I find that's why people want
to stay in an apartment over a hotel and things like that
I think that the movement is changing people when they go on vacation they want the story they want the history
they want to feel like they're part of Berlin

my first attempt to the street art and I
think I did pretty good
Well we're here in Kreuzberg Berlin with Martina
and we're at her complex The Five Lofts
and wow what an incredible job you have done
at making these into such beautiful living spaces
My husband bought this building 1986
Oh really?
it was a time when the wall was
and this was absolutely underdog
Yeah the area definitely
Nobody liked to come here
and all his friends were asking 'what are you doing?'
Fantastic you've done such a great job
with taking an older style building and making it such a comfortable place to come and stay
Well thanks for coming and it was a pleasure to meet you
a pleasure to meet you as well
